result.execSummary:
The defendant Bradley Mark Huggins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain GFE in fulltime work or fulltime school.

Complete SAFE Program.
Complete counseling or treatment as necessary by agent.
Take medications as prescribed.
1 day credit if revoked.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bradley Mark Huggins

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: 15CM501 & 15CM423- w/h sentencing. Probabtion for 2 years. Complete SAFE program or equivalent. Complete any counseling or treatment as necessary by agent. Absolute sobriety. AODA assessment with follow through. Take medications as perscribed. Maintain GFE in full time work or full time school. Pay court costs. Pay 2 Domestic Abuse surcharges. DNA surcharge. 1 day credit given if revoked. 
COURT ORDERS: 13CM2018- Impose 5 days MCJ. Pay $1179 fine inclusive. 12 months drivers license revocation. 12 months interlock device. AODA assessment with follow through. 1 day credit given. 
COURT ORDERS: 15CM505- Impose 45 days MCJ, consecutive, begin immediately. Pay $1494 fine inclusive. 24 months drivers license revocation, consecutive to other time. 12 months interlock device, consecutive to other time. Absolute sobriety. AODA assessment with follow through. Huber release for work search or treatment. 1 day credit given. 
COURT approves half price interlock device

State appears by ADA M.Puerner. Defendant appears in person/pro se/in custody.

State notes brief conversation w/defendant - Defendant states he is still in the process of obtaining counsel once his tax refund is obtained.
Defendant requests court appoint counsel - COURT notes IH held recently and defendant did not qualify, so COURT declines appointment.

COURT cancels jury trial set for next week - CC 4/20/15 at 1:00pm - COURT expects defendant to have obtained counsel by that date and matters to be reset for trial on oldest case; COURT will not delay matters any further for purposes of defendant obtaining counsel after this time.

Bond continues.

Adj: 10:09am

Case called: 10:50am. Clerk: Denise. Defendant appears prose. Court questions Dft. RE: Employment/Income. Defendant states he completed FDS and provided to COC- nothing found. Court denies apptment of Counsel, dft not found indigent. Adjourned: 10:52am.

Shall not consume alcohol. No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores or Beer Tents.   No contact with victim(s): S.S. & J.H. (NON WAIVABLE). Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. 3rd party visitation through Family Resource Center.
